schema.example:
Project Structure (root: my-app)
- src
  - main.ts
  - app.module.ts
- package.json
- tsconfig.json

bearer.description: Enter JWT token in the format: Bearer <token>

cookie.name: jwt
cookie.description: JWT stored in cookie (for web clients)

email.description: User email used to log in
Email address associated with the user

tokens.description: Access/refresh tokens returned by the provider

email.description: Unique email address of the user

password.description: Secure password with at least 8 characters

phone_number.description: Phone number of the user (E.164 format recommended)

filePath.description: The absolute or relative path to the file on the server, if applicable (e.g., for local files).

mimeType.description: The MIME type of the file (e.g., "text/plain", "application/json").

language.description: The detected programming language of the file content, if applicable (e.g., "typescript", "json", "markdown").

content.description: The content of the file. For text-based files, this is the raw text. For binary files, it is the base64-encoded string.

blob.description: A base64 encoded data URL (blob) of the file, if requested. Format: `data:[<mediatype>][;base64],<data>`

content.description: Optional content for the file (ignored if directory)

type.description: Whether it is a folder or a file.

oldPath.description: The current path of the file or folder to rename

newPath.description: The new desired path (including the new name)

success.description: Indicates if the rename operation was successful

message.description: A message describing the result of the operation

oldPath.description: The original path of the file or folder

newPath.description: The new path of the file or folder

directory.description: The root directory to start the search (defaults to current working directory)

searchTerm.description: The name or part of the name of the file/folder to search for

name.description: Name of the file or folder

path.description: Full path of the file or folder

isDirectory.description: Indicates if the item is a directory

type.description: Type of the item: file or folder

scanPaths.description: An array of paths (relative or absolute) to scan. Each path can be a directory or a file. Defaults to ["."].

projectRoot.description: The root directory of the project, used for calculating relative paths. Defaults to process.cwd() if not provided.

verbose.description: If true, logs detailed information during scanning.

relativePath.description: Path relative to the project root

size.description: Size of the file in bytes

modifiedTime.description: Last modified time of the file

content.description: Content to write to the file

command.description: Shell command to execute on remote server

output.description: Preferred output format of the optimized code

output.description: Preferred output format of the code analysis

topic.description: Optional topic or context for the code generation

language.description: Optional programming language of the code

topic.description: Optional topic or context for the code

isComment.description: Whether to generate documentation as inline code comments

output.description: Preferred output format of the documentation

prompt.example: What is shown in this image?
Provide a short caption for this file.

speaker.description: Speaker name as referenced in the prompt

voiceName.description: Voice name to use for the speaker

prompt.example:
Eddie: AI is changing everything!
Marionette: And it's influencing fashion too.

languageCode.description: Language code for the speech synthesis (optional)

prompt.description: The prompt text to send to the Gemini model.
prompt.example: Write a short story about a brave knight.

systemInstruction.description: Optional system instruction to guide the model's behavior (e.g., persona or style). If provided for a new conversation, it will be used for subsequent requests in that conversation.
systemInstruction.example: Act as a seasoned cybersecurity expert and explain common phishing techniques.

conversationId.description: Optional ID of an ongoing conversation. If provided, the system instruction from the first request in this conversation will be used.

prompt.description: The prompt text to accompany the image.

base64Image.description: The Base64 encoded image data (without "data:image/jpeg;base64," prefix).

mimeType.description: The MIME type of the image (e.g., "image/jpeg", "image/png").

systemInstruction.description: Optional system instruction to guide the model's behavior (e.g., persona or style). If provided for a new conversation, it will be used for subsequent requests in that conversation.
systemInstruction.example: Analyze this image from a botanical perspective.

conversationId.description: Optional ID of an ongoing conversation. If provided, the system instruction from the first request in this conversation will be used.

mime_type.description: The MIME type of the inline data (e.g., image/png, application/pdf)

data.description: Base64-encoded string of the file or image data

text.description: Text content of the message part
text.example: Hello, how can I help you?

role.description: The role of the message sender

parts.description: Array of message parts, each containing either text or inline data

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the message was created

prompt.description: The detailed prompt describing the resume to be generated. This should include personal details, desired job role, experience level, key skills, and any specific sections or formatting requirements.
prompt.example: Generate a resume for a senior software engineer with 10 years of experience in TypeScript, React, Node.js, and AWS. Include a strong summary, a detailed experience section with quantifiable achievements, education, and a skills section. Target roles in FinTech.

systemInstruction.description: Optional: Custom system instruction to guide the AI model on how to generate the resume (e.g., "Use a modern, minimalist design", "Focus on leadership experience"). Overrides default instructions.
systemInstruction.example: Generate the resume strictly in JSON format, outlining each section as a separate object.

conversationId.description: Optional: An existing conversation ID to maintain context with the AI model for continued interaction (e.g., if refining a previously generated resume).

resumeContent.description: The full plain text content of the resume to be enhanced.
resumeContent.example:
John Doe
Software Engineer
Experience:
- Developed X using Y...
Skills: Z

sectionToEnhance.description: Optional: A specific section of the resume to focus the enhancement on (e.g., "summary", "experience", "skills").

enhancementGoal.description: Optional: A specific goal or instruction for the enhancement (e.g., "make more concise", "add metrics", "target leadership roles").
enhancementGoal.example: Make the experience section more action-oriented with quantifiable results.

systemInstruction.description: Optional: Custom system instruction to guide the AI model for nuanced enhancement requests. Overrides default instructions.
systemInstruction.example: Ensure all bullet points start with strong action verbs and highlight agile methodologies.

conversationId.description: Optional: An existing conversation ID to maintain context with the AI model for continued interaction.

imageId.description: The ID of the AMI to use for the instance

instanceType.description: The type of instance to launch

securityGroupIds.description: The IDs of the security groups for the instance

subnetId.description: The ID of the subnet to launch the instance into

keyName.description: The name of the key pair to use for the instance

tags.description: Tags to apply to the instance

userData.description: User data to make available to the instance

TotalCost.description: The total cost for the requested time period, including metrics like BlendedCost.

Granularity.description: The granularity of the cost report (e.g., MONTHLY).

StartDate.description: The start date of the report in YYYY-MM-DD format.

EndDate.description: The end date of the report in YYYY-MM-DD format.

loader.description: The loader type for the code.

solid.description: Indicates if the code is SolidJS.

react.description: Indicates if the code is React.

type.description: Type of the recording (e.g., audio, video)

pid.description: Process ID related to this recording

createdById.description: ID of the user who created the recording

type.description: Type of the recording (e.g., audio, video)

pid.description: Process ID related to this recording

createdById.description: ID of the user who created the recording

filePath.description: Absolute or relative path to the markdown file to process

markdown.description: Raw markdown content to extract code blocks from (alternative to filePath)

description.description: A short description of the repository
description.example: A repository created via NestJS GitHub OAuth.

private.description: Whether the repository should be private (true) or public (false)

id.description: The GitHub ID of the repository

full_name.description: The full name including owner (e.g., octocat/oauth-repo-test)

description.description: A short description of the repository

html_url.description: URL to the repository on GitHub

private.description: Whether the repository is private or public

created_at.description: The date and time the repository was created

updated_at.description: The date and time the repository was last updated

pushed_at.description: The date and time the repository was last pushed to

message.description: The commit message for the file change
message.example: feat: add initial oauth commit-log file

git.description: Git API URL for the content

self.description: Self API URL for the content

html.description: HTML URL for the content on GitHub

name.description: Name of the file or directory

path.description: Path of the file or directory within the repository

size.description: Size of the content in bytes (for files only)

url.description: API URL to get the content details

html_url.description: HTML URL to view the content on GitHub

download_url.description: Download URL for file content (only for files)

content.description: Base64 encoded content of the file (only if fetching a single file and not directory listing)

filePath.description: Optional: The file path, used by ESLint to find configs/determine language. Relative to CWD.

cwd.description: Optional: The current working directory from which ESLint should resolve configurations and plugins.

code.description: The code content of the file to lint

filePath.description: The virtual file path for this code content, used by ESLint to find configs/determine language. Relative to CWD.

files.description: An array of file objects, each containing code content and its virtual file path.

cwd.description: Optional: The current working directory from which ESLint should resolve configurations and plugins.

directoryPath.description: The absolute or relative path to the directory to lint.

cwd.description: Optional: The current working directory from which ESLint should resolve configurations and plugins.

userPrompt.description: The main request or prompt from the user to the AI.
userPrompt.example: Implement a new user authentication module with JWT. Include login and register endpoints.

projectRoot.description: The absolute path to the root directory of the project being edited.

projectStructure.description: A high-level overview of the project directory structure, typically generated as a tree string or simplified list.
projectStructure.example:
project-root/
 src/
    app.module.ts
    app.controller.ts
    main.ts
 package.json
 tsconfig.json

relevantFiles.description: An array of relevant files from the project, including their paths and content, for the LLM to analyze or modify.

additionalInstructions.description: Additional instructions or constraints for the LLM regarding its behavior, style, or specific requirements.
additionalInstructions.example: Ensure all new code adheres to TypeScript strict mode. Use functional components for React. Avoid external libraries unless specified.

expectedOutputFormat.description: Detailed instructions on the exact JSON format the LLM is expected to return for its response.

scanPaths.description: An array of paths (relative to projectRoot) to explicitly scan. If not provided, the AI may decide which files to include based on context.

filePath.description: The absolute or relative path of the file to be changed.

action.description: The type of operation to perform on the file.

newContent.description: The new content of the file for "add" or "modify" operations. Not applicable for "delete".

reason.description: A brief explanation or justification for this specific file change.
reason.example: New component to display a welcome message.

changes.description: A list of proposed file changes generated by the LLM.

summary.description: A concise summary provided by the LLM, describing the overall changes or solution.
summary.example: Implemented a new React component `WelcomeMessage.tsx` to display a greeting message.

thoughtProcess.description: The LLM's detailed thought process or reasoning behind the proposed changes.
thoughtProcess.example: The user requested a React component, so I created a functional component in TypeScript. I decided to place it in `src/components` for better organization and provided a simple "Hello" message as a starting point, anticipating future customization.
